intro: Bellida major, commonly known as the greater bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, often with a white throat. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Bellida major thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
